article_title: Has the Affordable Care Act Proved Its Worth?
article_text:
Introduction

Joe Raedle/Getty Images

As the Supreme Court prepares a ruling that could knock out one of the pillars of the Affordable Care Act — subsidies for federal insurance exchanges — President Obama said that three years of experience have shown that the law works, and helps people.

But given what we know now about its implementation, should it be supported? Or would a ruling that jeopardizes existence be for the best?

article_metadata.description: A Supreme Court ruling could undermine the health care law after three years of seeing how well it works.
